title: How to Make Gluten Free Snickerdoodles

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350ºF/180ºC.
steps.description: Line the cookie sheet(s) with parchment paper.

steps.headline: Combine the sugar, butter substitute or oil, egg whites, milk and vanilla extract in one bowl.
Mix the flours, gum, cream of tartar, baking soda and powder, and salt in another bowl.
Add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture once they have been mixed.
Cover the bowl and place the dough into the refrigerator.
steps.description: Allow to chill for a half hour to an hour.

steps.headline: Mix the sugar and cinnamon ingredients.
Remove the dough from the refrigerator.
steps.description: Roll the cookie dough into 2-inch (5cm) balls. Roll the balls in the sugar-cinnamon mix until coated.

steps.headline: Arrange the balls on a cookie sheet.
steps.description: If you want the cookies flatter, dip a glass base into sugar and press down on each cookie ball to make flatter.

steps.headline: Place in the oven to bake.
steps.description: Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until the base of the cookies have browned slightly. Remove and leave on the cookie sheet to cool over a wire rack.

steps.headline: Store the cooled cookies in an airtight container.

text: Preheat the oven to 350ºF/180ºC. Line the cookie sheet(s) with parchment paper. Combine the sugar, butter substitute or oil, egg whites, milk and vanilla extract in one bowl.  Mix the flours, gum, cream of tartar, baking soda and powder, and salt in another bowl.  Add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture once they have been mixed. Mix well. Cover the bowl and place the dough into the refrigerator. Allow to chill for a half hour to an hour. Mix the sugar and cinnamon ingredients.  Remove the dough from the refrigerator. Roll the cookie dough into 2-inch (5cm) balls. Roll the balls in the sugar-cinnamon mix until coated. Arrange the balls on a cookie sheet. If you want the cookies flatter, dip a glass base into sugar and press down on each cookie ball to make flatter. Place in the oven to bake. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until the base of the cookies have browned slightly. Remove and leave on the cookie sheet to cool over a wire rack. Store the cooled cookies in an airtight container. Consume within 3 days. Finished.
